Vocalization given spontaneously at dawn.  Identified by Bret Whitney, who says this is a better match for brevirostris than for bartletti.  Habitat was tall forest on poor soils in terra firme.

Remarks: Very poor recording of a duet at dawn. It starts with a secondary vocalization (single whistles), followed by a long(primary) song at 13th s.
